00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: NEYS
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides conversions between Geodetic coordinates
00009  *    (latitude and longitude in radians) and Ney's (Modified Lambert
00010  *    Conformal Conic) projection coordinates (easting and northing in meters).
00011  *
00012  * ERROR HANDLING
00013  *
00014  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00015  *    is found the error code is combined with the current error code using
00016  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00017  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00018  *
00019  *       NEYS_NO_ERROR           : No errors occurred in function
00020  *       NEYS_LAT_ERROR          : Latitude outside of valid range
00021  *                                     (-90 to 90 degrees)
00022  *       NEYS_LON_ERROR          : Longitude outside of valid range
00023  *                                     (-180 to 360 degrees)
00024  *       NEYS_EASTING_ERROR      : Easting outside of valid range
00025  *                                     (depends on ellipsoid and projection
00026  *                                     parameters)
00027  *       NEYS_NORTHING_ERROR     : Northing outside of valid range
00028  *                                     (depends on ellipsoid and projection
00029  *                                     parameters)
00030  *       NEYS_FIRST_STDP_ERROR   : First standard parallel outside of valid
00031  *                                     range (71 or 74 degrees)
00032  *       NEYS_ORIGIN_LAT_ERROR   : Origin latitude outside of valid range
00033  *                                     (-89 59 59.0 to 89 59 59.0 degrees)
00034  *       NEYS_CENT_MER_ERROR     : Central meridian outside of valid range
00035  *                                     (-180 to 360 degrees)
00036  *       NEYS_A_ERROR            : Semi-major axis less than or equal to zero
00037  *       NEYS_INV_F_ERROR        : Inverse flattening outside of valid range
00038  *                                     (250 to 350)
00039  *
00040  *
00041  * REUSE NOTES
00042  *
00043  *    NEYS is intended for reuse by any application that performs a Ney's (Modified
00044  *    Lambert Conformal Conic) projection or its inverse.
00045  *
00046  * REFERENCES
00047  *
00048  *    Further information on NEYS can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00049  *
00050  *    NEYS originated from:
00051  *                      U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00052  *                      Geospatial Information Division
00053  *                      7701 Telegraph Road
00054  *                      Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00055  *
00056  * LICENSES
00057  *
00058  *    None apply to this component.
00059  *
00060  * RESTRICTIONS
00061  *
00062  *    NEYS has no restrictions.
00063  *
00064  * ENVIRONMENT
00065  *
00066  *    NEYS was tested and certified in the following environments:
00067  *
00068  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC, version 2.8.1
00069  *    2. Windows 95 with MS Visual C++, version 6
00070  *
00071  * MODIFICATIONS
00072  *
00073  *    Date              Description
00074  *    ----              -----------
00075  *    8-4-00            Original Code
00076  *    3-2-07            Original C++ Code
00077  *
00078  *
00079  *
00080  */
00081

00099  *    LambertConformalConic2.h  - Is used to convert lambert conformal conic coordinates
00100  *    Neys.h     - Is for prototype error checking
00101  *    MapProjectionCoordinates.h   - defines map projection coordinates
00102  *    GeodeticCoordinates.h   - defines geodetic coordinates
00103  *    CoordinateConversionException.h - Exception handler
00104  *    ErrorMessages.h  - Contains exception messages
00105  */

00112 /*                               DEFINES 
00113  *
00114  */
00115 
00116 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;                 /* PI     */
00117 const double PI_OVER_2 = (PI / 2.0);
00118 const double PI_OVER_180 = (PI / 180.0);
00119 const double TWO_PI = (2.0 * PI);
00120 const double SEVENTY_ONE = (71.0 * PI_OVER_180);          /* 71 degrees     */
00121 const double SEVENTY_FOUR = (74.0 * PI_OVER_180);         /* 74 degrees     */
00123 const double MAX_LAT = (89.999444444444444 * PI_OVER_180); /* 89 59 58.0 degrees     */
00124 
00125 
00126 /************************************************************************/
00127 /*                              FUNCTIONS     
00128  *
00129  */
00130 
00131 Neys::Neys( double ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis, double ellipsoidFlattening, double centralMeridian, double originLatitude, double standardParallel, double falseEasting, double falseNorthing ) :
00132   CoordinateSystem(),
00133   lambertConformalConic2( 0 ),
00134   Neys_Std_Parallel_1( SEVENTY_ONE ),
00135   Neys_Std_Parallel_2( MAX_LAT ),
00136   Neys_Origin_Long( 0.0 ),
00137   Neys_Origin_Lat( 80.0 * PI_OVER_180 ),
00138   Neys_False_Easting( 0.0 ),
00139   Neys_False_Northing( 0.0 ),
00140   Neys_Delta_Easting( 400000000.0 ),
00141   Neys_Delta_Northing( 400000000.0 )
00142 {
00143 /*
00144  * The constructor receives the ellipsoid parameters and
00145  * Ney's (Modified Lambert Conformal Conic) projection parameters as inputs, and sets the
00146  * corresponding state variables.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown 
00147  * with a description of the error.
00148  *
00149  *   ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (input)
00150  *   ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                   (input)
00151  *   centralMeridian         : Longitude of origin, in radians           (input)
00152  *   originLatitude          : Latitude of origin, in radians            (input)
00153  *   standardParallel        : First standard parallel, in radians       (input)
00154  *   falseEasting            : False easting, in meters                  (input)
00155  *   falseNorthing           : False northing, in meters                 (input)
00156  */
00157 
00158   double epsilon = 1.0e-10;
00159   double inv_f = 1 / ellipsoidFlattening;
00160   char errorStatus[500] = "";
00161 
00162   if (ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis <= 0.0)
00163   { /* Semi-major axis must be greater than zero */
00164     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::semiMajorAxis );
00165   }
00166   if ((inv_f < 250) || (inv_f > 350))
00167   { /* Inverse flattening must be between 250 and 350 */
00168     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFlattening );
00169   }
00170   if ((originLatitude < -MAX_LAT) || (originLatitude > MAX_LAT))
00171   { /* Origin Latitude out of range */
00172     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::originLatitude );
00173   }
00174   if ((fabs(standardParallel - SEVENTY_ONE) > epsilon) && (fabs(standardParallel - SEVENTY_FOUR) > epsilon))
00175   { /* First Standard Parallel invalid */
00176     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::standardParallel1 );
00177   }
00178   if ((centralMeridian < -PI) || (centralMeridian > TWO_PI))
00179   { /* Origin Longitude out of range */
00180     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::centralMeridian );
00181   }
00182 
00183   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00184     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00185 
00186   semiMajorAxis = ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis;
00187   flattening = ellipsoidFlattening;
00188 
00189   Neys_Origin_Lat = originLatitude;
00190   if (Neys_Origin_Lat >= 0)
00191   {
00192     Neys_Std_Parallel_1 = standardParallel;
00193     Neys_Std_Parallel_2 = MAX_LAT;
00194   }
00195   else
00196   {
00197     Neys_Std_Parallel_1 = -standardParallel;
00198     Neys_Std_Parallel_2 = -MAX_LAT;
00199   }
00200 
00201   if (centralMeridian > PI)
00202     centralMeridian -= TWO_PI;
00203   Neys_Origin_Long = centralMeridian;
00204   Neys_False_Easting = falseEasting;
00205   Neys_False_Northing = falseNorthing;
00206 
00207   lambertConformalConic2 = new LambertConformalConic( semiMajorAxis, flattening, Neys_Origin_Long, Neys_Origin_Lat,
00208                                                       Neys_Std_Parallel_1, Neys_Std_Parallel_2,
00209                                                       Neys_False_Easting, Neys_False_Northing );
00210 }
00211 
00212 
00213 Neys::Neys( const Neys &n )
00214 {
00215   lambertConformalConic2 = new LambertConformalConic( *( n.lambertConformalConic2 ) );
00216   semiMajorAxis = n.semiMajorAxis;
00217   flattening = n.flattening;
00218   Neys_Std_Parallel_1 = n.Neys_Std_Parallel_1;     
00219   Neys_Std_Parallel_2 = n.Neys_Std_Parallel_2; 
00220   Neys_Origin_Long = n.Neys_Origin_Long; 
00221   Neys_Origin_Lat = n.Neys_Origin_Lat; 
00222   Neys_False_Easting = n.Neys_False_Easting; 
00223   Neys_False_Northing = n.Neys_False_Northing; 
00224   Neys_Delta_Easting = n.Neys_Delta_Easting; 
00225   Neys_Delta_Northing = n.Neys_Delta_Northing; 
00226 }
00227 
00228 
00229 Neys::~Neys()
00230 {
00231   delete lambertConformalConic2;
00232   lambertConformalConic2 = 0;
00233 }

00235 
00236 Neys& Neys::operator=( const Neys &n )
00237 {
00238   if( this != &n )
00239   {
00240     lambertConformalConic2->operator=( *n.lambertConformalConic2 );
00241     semiMajorAxis = n.semiMajorAxis;
00242     flattening = n.flattening;
00243     Neys_Std_Parallel_1 = n.Neys_Std_Parallel_1;     
00244     Neys_Std_Parallel_2 = n.Neys_Std_Parallel_2; 
00245     Neys_Origin_Long = n.Neys_Origin_Long; 
00246     Neys_Origin_Lat = n.Neys_Origin_Lat; 
00247     Neys_False_Easting = n.Neys_False_Easting; 
00248     Neys_False_Northing = n.Neys_False_Northing; 
00249     Neys_Delta_Easting = n.Neys_Delta_Easting; 
00250     Neys_Delta_Northing = n.Neys_Delta_Northing; 
00251   }
00252 
00253   return *this;
00254 }

00256 
00257 NeysParameters* Neys::getParameters() const
00258 {
00259 /*
00260  * The function getParameters returns the current ellipsoid
00261  * parameters and Ney's (Modified Lambert Conformal Conic) projection parameters.
00262  *
00263  *   ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (output)
00264  *   ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                   (output)
00265  *   centralMeridian         : Longitude of origin, in radians           (output)
00266  *   originLatitude          : Latitude of origin, in radians            (output)
00267  *   standardParallel        : First standard parallel, in radians       (output)
00268  *   falseEasting            : False easting, in meters                  (output)
00269  *   falseNorthing           : False northing, in meters                 (output)
00270  */
00271 
00272   return new NeysParameters( CoordinateType::neys, Neys_Origin_Long, Neys_Origin_Lat, Neys_Std_Parallel_1, Neys_False_Easting, Neys_False_Northing );
00273 }
00274 
00275 
00276 MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* Neys::convertFromGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates )
00277 {
00278 /*
00279  * The function convertFromGeodetic converts Geodetic (latitude and
00280  * longitude) coordinates to Ney's (Modified Lambert Conformal Conic) projection
00281  * (easting and northing) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and
00282  * Ney's (Modified Lambert Conformal Conic) projection parameters.  If any errors 
00283  * occur, an exception is thrown with a description of the error.
00284  *
00285  *    longitude        : Longitude, in radians                        (input)
00286  *    latitude         : Latitude, in radians                         (input)
00287  *    easting          : Easting (X), in meters                       (output)
00288  *    northing         : Northing (Y), in meters                      (output)
00289  */
00290 
00291   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00292 
00293   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude();
00294   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00295 
00296   if ((latitude < -PI_OVER_2) || (latitude > PI_OVER_2))
00297   {  /* Latitude out of range */
00298     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00299   }
00300   if ((longitude < -PI) || (longitude > TWO_PI))
00301   {  /* Longitude out of range */
00302     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00303   }
00304 
00305   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00306     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00307 
00308   MapProjectionCoordinates* mapProjectionCoordinates = lambertConformalConic2->convertFromGeodetic( geodeticCoordinates );
00309   double easting = mapProjectionCoordinates->easting();
00310   double northing = mapProjectionCoordinates->northing();
00311   delete mapProjectionCoordinates;
00312 
00313   return new MapProjectionCoordinates( CoordinateType::neys, easting, northing );
00314 }
00315 
00316 
00317 MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* Neys::convertToGeodetic( MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* mapProjectionCoordinates )
00318 {
00319 /*
00320  * The function convertToGeodetic converts Ney's (Modified Lambert Conformal
00321  * Conic) projection (easting and northing) coordinates to Geodetic (latitude)
00322  * and longitude) coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Ney's
00323  * (Modified Lambert Conformal Conic) projection parameters.  If any errors 
00324  * occur, an exception is thrown with a description of the error.
00325  *
00326  *    easting          : Easting (X), in meters                       (input)
00327  *    northing         : Northing (Y), in meters                      (input)
00328  *    longitude        : Longitude, in radians                        (output)
00329  *    latitude         : Latitude, in radians                         (output)
00330  */
00331 
00332   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00333 
00334   double easting = mapProjectionCoordinates->easting();
00335   double northing = mapProjectionCoordinates->northing();
00336 
00337   if ((easting < (Neys_False_Easting - Neys_Delta_Easting))
00338       ||(easting > (Neys_False_Easting + Neys_Delta_Easting)))
00339   { /* Easting out of range  */
00340     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::easting );
00341   }
00342   if ((northing < (Neys_False_Northing - Neys_Delta_Northing))
00343       || (northing > (Neys_False_Northing + Neys_Delta_Northing)))
00344   { /* Northing out of range */
00345     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::northing );
00346   }
00347 
00348   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00349     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00350 
00351   GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates = lambertConformalConic2->convertToGeodetic( mapProjectionCoordinates );
00352   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude();
00353   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00354   delete geodeticCoordinates;
00355 
00356   return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, longitude, latitude );
00357 }
